intro: Hieracium concinnatum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers with a central disk. Hieracium concinnatum is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it thrives in temperate climates.
